bibl.title: Letter from Laura Wood to Philip Showalter Hench, December 16, 1941

div1.p: Wood tells Hench where Reed was located in the early to mid-1870's. If she returns to New York, she will examine the Lazear notebook and asks if there is anything he would like her to ask Malloch.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Wood to Philip Showalter Hench, December 16, 1941

opener.dateline:
1338 19th St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
December 16, 1941

div1.p:
Thank you very much for the reprint of Dr. Wilson's
paper, and for the information contained in your let-
ter. It is very kind of him to be willing to help me
further, and I shall write to him shortly.

I do not know whether or not Reed attended the Ameri-
can Public Health Association meeting that you refer
to, but I'll see if I can find out at the Surgeon
General's library.

I have just found that Dr. Kelly's account of Reed's
Bellevue years is not quite accurate. Reed is listed
as a student in the Bellevue Hospital Medical College
catalogue for the 1870-71 term, then is not listed
again until the 1873-74 circular, where he appears as
a graduate in the class of 1873. That's not very im-
portant, of course, but just serves to set the record
straight. So it appears that there was a year's in-
terval, so far unaccounted for, between his graduation
at Virginia and his first Bellevue term, and that he
took his Bellevue MD in two stretches.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, Laura Wood I may go with my husband to New York for New Years. If so,
I shall certainly read The Lazear notebook with the
greatest care. Is there anything special you would
like me to ask Dr Malloch about it?
lw
